keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and DOUGLAS DALBY

lead_paragraph: Not long ago, the vote would have been unthinkable. Ireland decriminalized homosexuality only in 1993. But the vote was 62 percent in favor, with 38 percent opposed.

headline.print_headline: Irish Legalize Gay Marriage by Big Margin
headline.main: Ireland Votes to Approve Gay Marriage, Putting Country in Vanguard

snippet: Not long ago, the vote would have been unthinkable. Ireland decriminalized homosexuality only in 1993. But the vote was 62 percent in favor, with 38 percent opposed.
abstract: Ireland becomes first nation to legalize same-sex marriage by popular vote, putting country at vanguard of social change; turnout is large--more than 60 percent of 3.2 million eligible voters cast ballots, and only 1 district out of 43 voted measure down.
